H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H5983.def: = nation; ◄ situated E. of river {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}; according to {S:00101903800100200} founded by {L:Ben-Ammi<SDBH:בֶּן־עַמִּי>}, son of {L:Lot<SDBH:לֹוט>}

H5012.def: = action by which humans speak or act as a prophet

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5983.def: = nation; ◄ situated E. of river {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}; according to {S:00101903800100200} founded by {L:Ben-Ammi<SDBH:בֶּן־עַמִּי>}, son of {L:Lot<SDBH:לֹוט>}

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3282.def: = a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

H4720.def: = part of an object that is considered more holy than the rest

H2490.def: = action by which priests disqualify themselves for religious service ◄ by unlawful behavior

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1473.def: = causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time

261.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H4181.def: = an area of land that is owned by an individual or group of people, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H2918.def: = community area of tents or other shelters, sometimes encircled by a barrier such as a stone wall, ► where a pastoral or nomadic people live; ≈ a more temporary and less populated settlement than a town

H4908.def: = location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H2461.def: = white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well-being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7237.def: = town, also known as {L:Rabbah of the Ammonites<SDBH:רַב>}, ◄ and located in Ammon; ► capital of the Ammonite kingdom, first conquered by {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} on their way from {L:Egypt<SDBH:מִצְרַיִם>}, and later again by {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H1581.def: = large quadruped mammal, which may reach a height of 2 m. or more; dromedaries are bigger and a uniform light fawn color; bactrians are darker; they are suited to life in desert areas, store excess food in their humps, can go without water for long periods, and can make long journeys through dry areas; ◄ Camelus dromedarius and Camelus bactrianus; ► they are used for riding and for carrying heavy loads and pulling carts; their hair is woven into cloth used for making tents or outer robes; their milk is used as food and drink; ≈ they are a symbol of wealth and commerce, but unclean and not to be eaten

H5983.def: = nation; ◄ situated E. of river {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}; according to {S:00101903800100200} founded by {L:Ben-Ammi<SDBH:בֶּן־עַמִּי>}, son of {L:Lot<SDBH:לֹוט>}

H4769.def: literally: a place for lying down; hence: = a place where animals can rest in relative safety

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3282.def: = a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

H4222.def: = action by which humans strike the palms of their hands together repeatedly ► as an expression of joy

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7554.def: = action by which humans bring down their foot with force on the ground or an object

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve
